message.content:
<<<api>>>: String.getBytes
<<<code>>>: 
public static void prependTextToFile(String text, String filePath) {
    try {
        // Read existing file content
        byte[] existingBytes = Files.readAllBytes(Paths.get(filePath));

        // Convert new text to bytes
        byte[] newBytes = text.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);

        // Create output stream
        ByteArrayOutputStream outputStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
        outputStream.write(newBytes);
        outputStream.write(existingBytes);

        // Write to file
        Files.write(Paths.get(filePath), outputStream.toByteArray());
    } catch (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code reads the existing content of the file into a byte array, then converts the new text to be prepended into a byte array. It then creates an output stream and writes the new text's bytes followed by the existing content's bytes into the stream. Finally, it writes the combined bytes back into the file. This effectively prepends the new text to the file.
